description:
Cancel a prediction that is currently running.

Example cURL request that creates a prediction and then cancels it:

```console
# First, create a prediction
PREDICTION_ID=$(curl -s -X POST \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $REPLICATE_API_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "input": {
      "prompt": "a video that may take a while to generate"
    }
  }' \
  https://api.replicate.com/v1/models/minimax/video-01/predictions | jq -r '.id')

# Echo the prediction ID
echo "Created prediction with ID: $PREDICTION_ID"

# Cancel the prediction
curl -s -X POST \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $REPLICATE_API_TOKEN" \
  https://api.replicate.com/v1/predictions/$PREDICTION_ID/cancel
```

parameters.description: The ID of the prediction to cancel.
parameters.name: prediction_id

completed_at.description: The time that the model completed the prediction and all outputs were uploaded

created_at.description: The time that the prediction was created

data_removed.description: Whether the prediction output has been deleted

deadline.description: The absolute time at which the prediction will be automatically canceled if it has not completed

deployment.description: The name of the deployment that created the prediction

error.description: An error string if the model status is `"failed"`

logs.description: The log output from the model

metrics.description: Additional metrics associated with the prediction

total_time.description: The total time, in seconds, that the prediction took to complete

model.description: The name of the model that created the prediction

output.description: The prediction output, which can be any JSON-serializable value, depending on the model

source.description: Indicates how the prediction was created

started_at.description: The time that the model began the prediction

status.description: The prediction status. `canceled` means the prediction was canceled (either by the user or because it reached its deadline while running). `aborted` means the prediction was terminated before it started running (for example, when a deadline is reached before the prediction starts).

urls.description: URLs for working with the prediction

get.description: Retrieve the latest state of the prediction via API

stream.description: An event source to stream the output of the prediction via API

web.description: View the prediction in a browser

oneOf.description: The ID of the model version that created the prediction
The model does not support versions, used by official models.
